document.masterDocTitle: Studies of Madagascan Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) 3: The genus Acrotrichis including twenty seven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Studies of Madagascan Ptiliidae (Coleoptera) 3: The genus Acrotrichis including twenty seven new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Habitus
Fig. 15 A
. Length 0.57 mm . Colour dark reddish brown, antennae and legs dusky yellow, the two basal segments of the antennae slightly lighter. Antennomeres 3–11 0.24 mm long
Fig. 15
C. Mentum and submentum chaetotaxy
Fig. 15
J. Width across eyes 0.23 mm . Pronotum 0.32 mm wide, 0.17 mm long, sides with a slight sinuation before the posterior angles
Fig. 15
B. Elytra 0.34 mm long, 0.32 mm wide. Posterior margin of the mesoventral collar slightly sloped at shoulders and with a shallow median excision
Fig.
15
F. Posterior margin of metaventrum and metacoxal plates
Fig. 15
G. Pygidium without an apical tooth.

Male : ventrite six with +/- 7 spines
Fig.
15
I; aedeagus
Fig. 15
E.

Remarks. The smallest and apparently the most widespread of the small species. The spermatheca is the most reliable distinguishing feature though this is somewhat variable particularly in the size of the pump and the diameter of the duct.

Type data.
Holotype : ♂, Ranomafana N.P., Vatoharanana RNF
